alert.note: Alert for Callaway (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 04 at 10:03PM CDT until August 04 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL CALLAWAY COUNTY... At 1003 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Fulton, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Callaway County, including the following locations... Reform. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri near exit 161. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
